detaileddescription.para: Create a GSpinorBasis from scalar bases that are not necessarily equal.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar bases for the alpha and beta components of the spinors.
The transformation that relates the current set of spinors with the atomic spinors.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarBasis< Shell > &alpha_scalar_basis, const ScalarBasis< Shell > &beta_scalar_basis, const Transformation &C)
memberdef.name: GSpinorBasis

detaileddescription.para: Create a GSpinorBasis from scalar bases that are not necessarily equal.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which the alpha components of the spinors are expanded.
The scalar basis in which the beta components of the spinors are expanded.
The transformation that relates the current set of spinors with the atomic spinors.

detaileddescription.para:
Construct a generalized spinor basis in which both underlying scalar bases are equal. ^
scalar_basis
The scalar basis in which both the alpha and beta components are expanded.
C
The transformation that relates the current set of spinors with the atomic spinors.
Construct a generalized spinor basis with two different underlying scalar basis, and a coefficient matrix being the identity. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which the alpha components of the spinors are expanded.
The scalar basis in which the beta components of the spinors are expanded.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a generalized spinor basis in which both underlying scalar bases are equal, and a coefficient matrix being the identity. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which both the alpha and beta components are expanded.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a generalized spinor basis with an underlying scalar basis (equal for both the alpha and beta components) that is made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specification on every nucleus of the nuclear framework. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the non-orthogonal atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The nuclear framework containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G".

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a generalized spinor basis with an underlying scalar basis (equal for both the alpha and beta components) that is made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specification on every nucleus of the molecule. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the non-orthogonal atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The molecule containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G".

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a generalized spinor basis with a underlying scalar bases made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specifications on every nucleus of the nuclear framework. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the non-orthogonal atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The nuclear framework containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the alpha component.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the beta component.

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct a generalized spinor basis with a underlying scalar bases made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specifications on every nucleus of the molecule. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the non-orthogonal atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The molecule containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the alpha component.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the beta component.

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

parameterdescription.para: Alpha or beta.

simplesect.para: The number of coefficients that are used for the expansion of the requested spin-component of a spinor.
The number of spinors that are described by this generalized spinor basis.

memberdef.argsstring: (const FQOneElectronOperator &fq_one_op) const -> GSQOneElectronOperator< product_t< typename FQOneElectronOperator::Scalar, ExpansionScalar >, typename FQOneElectronOperator::Vectorizer >
memberdef.name: quantize

detaileddescription.para: Quantize a one-electron operator in this general spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: a spin-independent first-quantized operator (i.e. whose two-component matrix operator form contains the same scalar operator in the upper-left and lower-right corners)

simplesect.para: the second-quantized operator corresponding to the given spin-independent first-quantized operator

memberdef.argsstring: (const ElectronicSpinOperator &fq_one_op) const -> GSQOneElectronOperator< product_t< ElectronicSpinOperator::Scalar, ExpansionScalar >, ElectronicSpinOperator::Vectorizer >
memberdef.name: quantize

detaileddescription.para: Quantize the electronic spin operator in this general spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: The (first-quantized) electronic spin operator.

simplesect.para: The electronic spin operator expressed in this spinor basis.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CoulombRepulsionOperator &coulomb_op) const -> GSQTwoElectronOperator< product_t< CoulombRepulsionOperator::Scalar, ExpansionScalar >, CoulombRepulsionOperator::Vectorizer >
memberdef.name: quantize

detaileddescription.para: Quantize the Coulomb operator in this general spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: The first-quantized Coulomb operator.

simplesect.para: The second-quantized operator corresponding to the Coulomb operator.
The scalar bases for the alpha and beta components of the spinors.

detaileddescription.para: MARK: Mulliken partitioning Partition this set of generalized spinors according to the Mulliken partitioning scheme.

parameterdescription.para: A function that returns true for basis functions that should be included the Mulliken partitioning.

simplesect.para: A GMullikenPartitioning for the AOs selected by the supplied selector function.
The underlying scalar bases are assumed to be equal.

detaileddescription.para: Partition this set of generalized spinors according to the Mulliken partitioning scheme.

parameterdescription.para: A function that returns true for shells that should be included the Mulliken partitioning.

simplesect.para: A GMullikenPartitioning for the AOs selected by the supplied selector function.
The underlying scalar bases are assumed to be equal.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a restricted spin-orbital basis into a generalized framework, yielding a generalized coefficient matrix that is spin-blocked out.

parameterdescription.para: The restricted spinor basis.

simplesect.para: The restricted spinor basis as a generalized one.

detaileddescription.para: Convert an unrestricted spin-orbital basis into a generalized framework, yielding a generalized coefficient matrix that is spin-blocked out.

parameterdescription.para: The unrestricted spinor basis.

simplesect.para: The generalized spinor basis corresponding to the unrestricted spin-orbital basis.
We assume that the unrestricted spin-orbital basis has equal underlying scalar bases for the alpha- and beta-spin-orbitals.

detaileddescription.para: A general spinor basis, i.e. a spinor basis without any restrictions on the expansion of the alpha and beta components of the spinors in terms of the underlying (possibly different) scalar bases.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar type used to represent an expansion coefficient of the spinors in the underlying scalar orbitals: real or complex.
The type of shell the underlying scalar bases contain.

simplesect.para: The individual columns of the coefficient matrix represent the spinors of this basis; they are not ordered by increasing single-particle energy.
